amendment.description: Amendment prohibits the Department of Labor from enforcing regulations that require workers to wear long pants when this requirement would cause workers to experience extreme discomfort due to high air temperatures.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 28 in the Congressional Record of July 10, 1996 to prohibit OSHA from using funds appropriated in the bill to enforce federal regulations that require road construction workers to wear long pants if there is a health risk associated with excessively hot working conditions.

vote.text: On agreeing to the McIntosh amendment (A032) Agreed to by voice vote.
